授業目的: This course is designed for students who want to learn what it is to be a woman in modern Japan. The course will be wide-ranging, considering the voices of historical figures and looking at social and cultural issues in the light of gender roles. It will also examine historical and political phenomena, bearing in mind the formulation ‘the personal is political’, which has been influential in women’s studies. The course will also have a comparative component, particularly in respect of feminist and gender issues in the US and elsewhere in the West.
到達目標:
Students taking this course will be able to consider various issues faced by women in contemporary Japanese society.

Students will be able to:
1. learn about the social and cultural issues in the light of gender roles.
2. learn about historical and political phenomena, bearing in mind the formulation ‘the personal is political’, which has been influential in women’s studies.
3. compare and understand feminist and gender issues in the US and elsewhere in the West
特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法: Face to face format. Lecture and discussion

第2回: Japanese women’s voices in the modern period.
第3回: The notion of the good wife and wise mother (良妻賢母), and the myth of maternity (母性).
第6回: The franchise movement and political participation.
第7回: The Anpo struggle and the women’s liberation movement.
第8回: The influence of the second wave of feminism.
第9回: The rise of the women’s movement and feminist studies.
第10回: The desire to be a housewife (専業主婦)vs professional women
第13回: Students’ presentations and disStudents’ presentations and discussion
